<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 173, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 259]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 292]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 291]]<|/det|> 9702/31 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 359, 316]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|> October/November 2024 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 285, 450]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 808, 467]]<|/det|> Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|> Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|> Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|> Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 798, 544]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 892, 575]]<|/det|> You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 320, 590]]<|/det|> You may use a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 590, 578, 606]]<|/det|> You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 635, 213, 650]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 384, 666]]<|/det|> The total mark for this paper is 40. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 730, 682]]<|/det|> The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 732, 905, 860]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[270, 867, 728, 883]]<|/det|> This document has 16 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[66, 102, 84, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 777, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the equilibrium position of a wooden strip.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 510, 152]]<|/det|>
Some of the apparatus has been set up for you.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 163, 146, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 163, 544, 183]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 191, 900, 556]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 572, 530, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 603, 765, 623]]<|/det|>
Ensure the rod of the clamp is approximately \(15 \text{cm}\) above the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 635, 175, 653]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 635, 907, 670]]<|/det|>
Arrange the wooden strip so that the bottom of the strip rests against the base of the stand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 681, 175, 698]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 681, 905, 700]]<|/det|>
Use adhesive putty to fix the string centrally on the wooden strip in line with the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 712, 175, 730]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 712, 475, 730]]<|/det|>
Wrap the string around the screw.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 190, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 71, 638, 88]]<|/det|>
Arrange the block and protractor as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 98, 784, 428]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 440, 534, 459]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1.2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 471, 180, 489]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 471, 784, 490]]<|/det|>
The length of the coiled section of the spring is \(L_0\), as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 502, 920, 536]]<|/det|>
The angle between the lower edge of the wooden strip and the horizontal is \(\theta_0\), as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 549, 920, 583]]<|/det|>
Adjust the apparatus until \(\theta_0\) is between \(75^{\circ}\) and \(85^{\circ}\). You may wish to move the protractor along the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 597, 180, 615]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 597, 450, 615]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(L_0\) and \(\theta_0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 657, 918, 676]]<|/det|>
<form>L_0 = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[546, 704, 920, 722]]<|/det|>
<form>θ_0 = .................................................... .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 720, 920, 737]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 917, 91]]<|/det|>
Make a hook from one paper clip and hang nine paper clips from it as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 100, 636, 225]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 243, 534, 262]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 273, 180, 292]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 273, 494, 293]]<|/det|>
The mass of all ten paper clips is \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 305, 390, 323]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[549, 350, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
<form>m = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 382, 144, 401]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 382, 898, 401]]<|/det|>
Using the mass hanger and slotted masses, hang a mass of \(40\mathrm{g}\) from the string loop.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 413, 170, 432]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 413, 707, 432]]<|/det|>
Hang the paper clips from the string loop as shown in Fig. 1.4.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[44, 440, 937, 887]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 897, 534, 915]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 148, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Vary \(M\). The total mass \(M\) may be made from slotted masses only or from \(m\) and slotted masses. For each value of \(M\), measure and record \(M\), \(\theta\) and \(L\). Repeat until you have six sets of values.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 752, 152]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(e\) and \(\sin \theta\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 494, 920, 511]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 523, 144, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 523, 173, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 523, 665, 541]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of e on the \(y\)-axis against \(\sin \theta\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 523, 920, 541]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 555, 180, 572]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 555, 458, 572]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 555, 920, 572]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 585, 183, 603]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 585, 608, 603]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[477, 787, 915, 804]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 819, 915, 836]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 833, 920, 851]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 71, 739, 91]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 536, 122]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate oscillations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 866, 152]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a board of width \(w\) and thickness \(x\), as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 159, 868, 271]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 282, 591, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1 (not to scale)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 313, 400, 332]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(w\) and \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 344, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
<form>w = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[560, 375, 920, 393]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 392, 920, 411]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 422, 146, 441]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 422, 181, 441]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[218, 422, 583, 441]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 448, 885, 710]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 720, 534, 739]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 752, 798, 770]]<|/det|>
Ensure the rods of the clamps are the same height above the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 784, 918, 819]]<|/det|>
Slide the rods of the clamps through the holes in the board as shown in Fig. 2.2. Ensure that each end of the board touches a stand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 883, 91]]<|/det|>
The distance between the inside edges of the stands is \(d\), as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 102, 714, 121]]<|/det|>
Adjust the apparatus until \(d\) is in the range \(92 \text{cm}\) to \(99 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 425, 151]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 196, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
<form>d = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 227, 180, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 227, 813, 245]]<|/det|>
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(d\). Show your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 383, 920, 402]]<|/det|>
<form>percentage uncertainty = .................................................... %

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 144, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 415, 611, 433]]<|/det|>
Place the spring in the middle of the curved board.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 445, 180, 464]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 445, 767, 464]]<|/det|>
Displace the spring a short distance to one side, as shown in Fig. 2.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 470, 784, 579]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 590, 534, 607]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 621, 180, 638]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 621, 764, 638]]<|/det|>
Release the spring. The spring will roll from side to side on the board.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 651, 180, 670]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 651, 747, 670]]<|/det|>
Take measurements to determine the period \(T\) of these oscillations.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 821, 920, 839]]<|/det|>
<form>T = .................................................... $
